Articles.Content:
Hello, I'm creating this topic because I've got a problem with my game; every time i add a mod or modify a CFG file, when I start my game and i choose my save it doesn't show the ksc to the correct angle, my camera is between the VAB and the kerbals hire center. but that's not all. I can't move my cam or click on a building to go in, and when I load quicksave or autosave, I can go to the quick/auto saved ship but, same thing, I can't interact with the ship or move my cam. the only option I found for now is to restart my game, but I've installed more than 30 mods so It's really really annoying to wait until game restarts... Anyone here had the same issue? And did someone found something to stop that?
Thanks
What are the specs of your computer? Also, what configs are you editing? Could you also post a list of the mods you have installed?
When that happens, I press [key]esc[/key] and go back to the start menu and then reenter the game, usually fixes everything.

I've ecounter this situation a lot! It seems to happen only on my long time career save(with 30+ active flight). Whenever this happen, I still can click the back to main menu and Resume save again then it'll usually work for me. However, sometimes the option on the resume saved page won't be clickable and grayed out but I can fix that by switching my current focus window to something else, like file explorer or internet browser etc.
Try doing Alt-F12 and clearing the input locks.

I have had this issue ALOT, and i found its actually caused when you click out of KSP (when you have 2 screens) during the loading process of the save, so you either have to click out right after you load the save, or keep KSP as your window until it's loaded in. It happens a lot more in modded/higher flight saves, as there is more load time

I had something that sounds pretty similar with Kerbal Alarm Clock. It was caused by loading one save, then switching to a different one at a later time that was beyond one of the alarms I had set.
If you have Kerbal Alarm Clock, try removing it and see if the problem still occurs.

Also, in the future, please post requests for help in the Support forum.
